mainBoard.name: Black Lotus
mainBoard.originalText: Adds 3 mana of any single color of your choice to your mana pool, then is discarded. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.
mainBoard.text: {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add three mana of any one color.

mainBoard.name: Blight
mainBoard.originalText: If target land becomes tapped, it is destroyed at the end of the turn.
mainBoard.text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.

mainBoard.name: Desert Twister
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy any card in play.
mainBoard.text: Destroy target permanent.

foreignData.name: Dingus-Ei
foreignData.text: Jedesmal, wenn ein sich im Spiel befindliches Land auf den Friedhof gelegt wird, fügt das Dingus-Ei dessen Beherrscher 2 Schadenspunkte zu.

mainBoard.name: Dingus Egg
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever anyone loses a land, Dingus Egg does 2 damage to that player for each land lost.
mainBoard.text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, this artifact deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

foreignData.name: Zersetzung
foreignData.text: Die Zersetzung verursacht bei einem Spieler oder einer Kreatur X Schadenspunkte. Das Ziel des Spruchs kann in diesem Spielzug nicht regenerieren. Sollte die Kreatur in diesem Spielzug sterben, entferne sie ganz aus dem Spiel.

mainBoard.name: Disintegrate
mainBoard.originalText: Disintegrate does X damage to one target. If target dies this turn, target is removed from the game entirely.

rulings.text: Disintegrated creatures do not go to the graveyard at all before being exiled. They do not trigger abilities which trigger due to a creature going to the graveyard.

The “can’t regenerate” is an effect of Disintegrate and not an effect of the damage. It works even if the damage is prevented or redirected. If redirected, the damage does not take this effect with it.

mainBoard.text: Disintegrate deals X damage to any target. If it's a creature, it can't be regenerated this turn, and if it would die this turn, exile it instead.

foreignData.name: Zwiespaltsszepter
foreignData.text:
3, {T}: Der Gegner muß eine Karte seiner Wahl ablegen.
Das Zwiespaltsszepter kann nur während des Spielzuges seines Beherrschers eingesetzt werden.

mainBoard.name: Disrupting Scepter
mainBoard.originalText: {3}, ocT: Opponent must discard one card of his or her choice. Can only be used during controller's turn.

rulings.text: You can use it on yourself.

mainBoard.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate only during your turn.

foreignData.name: Erdbeben
foreignData.text: Das Erdbeben fügt jedem Spieler und jeder Kreatur ohne Flugfähigkeit X Schadenspunkte zu.

mainBoard.name: Earthquake
mainBoard.originalText: Does X damage to each player and each non-flying creature in play.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

mainBoard.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

mainBoard.flavorText: "What do you have that I cannot obtain?" —Mairsil, called the Pretender
mainBoard.name: Fellwar Stone
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add 1 mana to your mana pool. This mana may be of any color that any of opponent's lands can produce. This ability is played as an interrupt.

rulings.text: It only produces one mana even if the land can produce more than one.
The ability can be activated if the opponent has no lands that produce mana, but the effect will not be able to generate any mana.
This works even if the opponent's lands are tapped. It only checks what kinds of mana can be produced, not if the abilities that produce them are usable right now.

Fellwar Stone checks the effects of all mana-producing abilities of lands your opponents control, but it doesn't check their costs. For example, Vivid Crag has the ability "{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color." If an opponent controls Vivid Crag and you control Fellwar Stone, you can tap Fellwar Stone for any color of mana. It doesn't matter whether Vivid Crag has a charge counter on it, and it doesn't matter whether it's untapped.

Fellwar Stone doesn't care about any restrictions or riders your opponents' lands (such as Ancient Ziggurat or Hall of the Bandit Lord) put on the mana they produce. It just cares about colors of mana.
The colors of mana are white, blue, black, red, and green. Fellwar Stone can't be tapped for colorless mana, even if a land an opponent controls could produce colorless mana.

When determining what colors of mana your opponents' lands could produce, take into account any applicable replacement effects that would apply to those lands' mana abilities (such as Contamination's effect, for example). If there is more than one, consider them in any possible order.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

foreignData.name: Feuerball
foreignData.text: Der Feuerball verursacht insgesamt X Schaden. Dieser wird gleichmäßig (abgerundet) über Zielkreaturen und/oder Spieler verteilt. Bezahle zusätzlich 1 für jedes Ziel mit Ausnahme des ersten.

mainBoard.name: Fireball
mainBoard.originalText: Fireball does X damage total, divided evenly (round down) among any number of targets. Pay 1 extra mana for each target beyond the first.

rulings.text: Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal as Fireball resolves.

For example, if X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R} and its mana value is 6). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.

mainBoard.text:
This spell costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of targets.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Must not all things at the last be swallowed up in death?" —Plato
mainBoard.name: Fissure
mainBoard.originalText: Target land or creature is buried.
mainBoard.text: Destroy target creature or land. It can't be regenerated.

mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add {G} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add {G} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.name: Forest
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add {G} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.name: Gem Bazaar
mainBoard.text:
When Gem Bazaar comes into play, choose a random color.
{T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of the color last chosen. Then choose a random color.

mainBoard.flavorText: "...There was no trace/ Of aught on that illumined face..." —Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"

foreignData.name: Hypnotisierendes Gespenst
foreignData.text:
Kann fliegen.
Fügt das Gespenst einem Spieler Schaden zu, so muß dieser eine zufällig gewählte Karte aus seiner Hand abwerfen. Hat derjenige Spieler keine Karten auf der Hand, ignoriere diesen Effekt.

mainBoard.name: Hypnotic Specter
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
An opponent damaged by Specter must discard a card at random from his or her hand. Ignore this effect if opponent has no cards left in hand.

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if the Specter’s damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
Whenever this creature deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

foreignData.name: Blitzschlag
foreignData.text: Der Blitz fügt einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler 3 Schadenspunkte zu.

mainBoard.name: Lightning Bolt
mainBoard.originalText: Lightning Bolt does 3 damage to one target.
mainBoard.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to any target.

foreignData.name: Manasegen
foreignData.text: Wann immer einer der Spieler ein Land wegen Mana tappt, erhält er 1 weiteres Mana des gleichen Typs.

mainBoard.name: Mana Flare
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever either player taps a land for mana, it produces 1 extra mana of the appropriate type.

rulings.text: If you tap a land for more than one mana, you choose one type that was produced and add one mana of that type.

Mana Flare doesn't care about any restrictions or riders your lands put on the mana they produce, such as those of Unclaimed Territory and Cavern of Souls. It just produces one mana of the appropriate type, with no restrictions or riders.
The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.

mainBoard.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana of any type that land produced.

foreignData.name: Wahnsinn
foreignData.text: Ein Spieler Deiner Wahl muß X zufällig ausgesuchte Karten aus seiner Hand abwerfen. Hat er nicht genug Karten, dann muß er alle seine Karten abwerfen.

mainBoard.name: Mind Twist
mainBoard.originalText: Opponent must discard X cards at random from hand. If opponent doesn't have enough cards in hand, entire hand is discarded.
mainBoard.text: Target player discards X cards at random.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {R}.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"

{B}{B}{B}, ocT: Look at opponent's hand.
If opponent has any creature cards in hand, he or she discards one of them at random. This ability can only be used during controller's turn.
mainBoard.text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals their hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate only during your turn.

mainBoard.originalText: Destroys any one land.
mainBoard.text: Destroy target land.

mainBoard.flavorText: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominia itself a casualty of war.

mainBoard.name: Tranquility
mainBoard.originalText: All enchantments in play must be discarded.
mainBoard.text: Destroy all enchantments.

mainBoard.flavorText: An ever-moving swarm of dust engulfs and disorients anything that comes near.
mainBoard.name: Wall of Dust
mainBoard.originalText: Creatures blocked by Wall of Dust cannot attack during your opponent's next turn. Use counters to mark these creatures.
mainBoard.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever this creature blocks a creature, that creature can't attack during its controller's next turn.

foreignData.name: Düsternis
foreignData.text: Das Sprechen weißer Zaubersprüche verteuert sich um 3 Mana. Weiße Verzauberungen mit Aktivierungskosten werden ebenfalls um 3 Mana teurer.

sideBoard.name: Gloom
sideBoard.originalText: White spells cost 3 more mana to cast. White enchantments with activation costs require 3 more mana to use.

rulings.text: The additional mana is paid at the same time the spell/ability is cast/activated.
The extra mana is not considered part of the activation cost. It is a separate cost.
The extra mana is part of the total cost, so cost reducers can be applied to this cost.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

sideBoard.text:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.
Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.
